result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard John James Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes:
with Huber. No Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer or out of county travel.  To begin service within the next 60 days.
Consecutive to: Count 4.

records.addlTxt: 1:15 pm case called. Defendant Richard John James Cotton in court with attorney David Kidd.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed. Attorney Kidd confirms receipt and waives formal reading. Preliminary hearing waived on Amended Information. Court accepts waiver and binds defendant over for trial.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 3 & 4.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. State and Defense waive PSI. Court waives PSI. Argument by DA Folger. Argument by Attorney Kidd. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 6 months WCJ, STAYED and placed on probation for a period of 18 months. Concurrent to each other. Credit for 2 days time served.  CONDITIONS: 15 days WCJ on each count, consecutive to each other, with Huber, No Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served. To begin service within the next 60 days. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-24-2016 01:00 pm

2:32 pm case called. Attorney John Scott Schiro in court.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shiro requests pleas/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Status conference at 10-20-2015 09:00 am

2:29 am case called. Defendant Richard John James Cotton in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Schiro makes statement regarding motion to dismiss counts 3 & 4. Court holds in abeyance of determination of motion to dismiss. State calls Det. Nathan Klapoetke, witness sworn by clerk, testimony given. Positive identification of defendant. Attorney Schiro questions witness. Re-direct by Attorney Folger. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed within the courts jurisdiction and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Schiro confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters a plea of Not Guilty to all counts.  Attorney Schiro makes statement requesting bond modification. Attorney Folger objects to request for bond modification. Court respectfully declines request for bond modification.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:46 PM: Defendant Richard John James Cotton in court with attorney George David Kidd, both appearing via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  DA argues as to cash bond w/conditions.  Atty Kidd argues for "PR" bond.  The Court:  Orders $500 cash bond w/conditions.  INIT to proceed by agreement of counsel.  Court accepts voluntary waiver of personal appearance of Def and counsel.  Receipt of complaint affirmed.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive 10 day time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 20 day time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State - probable cause found for each charge in the compl  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.
